TrackBar Class

Definition

Represents a standard Windows track bar.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultBindingProperty("Value")]
[System.ComponentModel.DefaultEvent("Scroll")]
[System.ComponentModel.DefaultProperty("Value")]
[System.ComponentModel.Designer("System.Windows.Forms.Design.TrackBarDesigner, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterface(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType.AutoDispatch)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public class TrackBar : System.Windows.Forms.Control, System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize

Remarks

The TrackBar is a scrollable control similar to the ScrollBar control. You can configure ranges through which the value of the Value property of a track bar scrolls by setting the Minimum property to specify the lower end of the range and the Maximum property to specify the upper end of the range.

The LargeChange property defines the increment to add or subtract from the Value property when clicks occur on either side of the scroll box. The track bar can be displayed horizontally or vertically.

You can use this control to input numeric data obtained through the Value property. You can display this numeric data in a control or use it in code.

Constructors

TrackBar()

Initializes a new instance of the TrackBar class.

public TrackBar ();

Remarks

The TrackBar is created with a default horizontal orientation and a range of 0 to 10, with a tick mark shown for every value.

Properties

AutoSize

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the height or width of the track bar is being automatically sized.

public override bool AutoSize { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the track bar is being automatically sized; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

You can set the AutoSize property to true to cause the track bar to adjust its height (if horizontally aligned) or width (if vertically aligned). The height or width is adjusted to a standard size based on the screen resolution on which the track bar is displayed. Set the AutoSize property to false if you want to adjust the size yourself.

BackgroundImage

Gets or sets the background image for the TrackBar control.

public override System.Drawing.Image BackgroundImage { get; set; }
Value
Image

The Image that is the background image for the TrackBar.

Remarks

The BackgroundImage property has no effect on the appearance of the TrackBar control; therefore, it is hidden in the designer and from IntelliSense.

BackgroundImageLayout

Gets or sets an ImageLayout value; however, setting this property has no effect on the TrackBar control.

public override System.Windows.Forms.ImageLayout BackgroundImageLayout { get; set; }
Value
ImageLayout

One of the ImageLayout values.

Remarks

Setting the BackgroundImageLayout property will have no effect on the TrackBar control; therefore, this property is not shown in the designer or by IntelliSense.

CreateParams

Overrides the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateParams* property.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams CreateParams { get; }
Value
CreateParams

A CreateParams that contains the required creation parameters when the handle to the control is created.

DefaultImeMode

Gets a value indicating the mode for the Input Method Editor (IME) for the TrackBar.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode DefaultImeMode { get; }
Value
ImeMode

Always ImeMode.

DefaultSize

Gets the default size of the TrackBar.

protected override System.Drawing.Size DefaultSize { get; }
Value
Size

A Size representing the default size of the control.

Remarks

The default width is 104 pixels; the height will vary. You can override this property in a derived class to provide a different default size.

DoubleBuffered

Gets or sets a value indicating whether this control should redraw its surface using a secondary buffer to reduce or prevent flicker; however, this property has no effect on the TrackBar control

protected override bool DoubleBuffered { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the control has a secondary buffer; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Setting this property has no effect on the TrackBar control; therefore, it is not shown in the designer or by IntelliSense.

Font

Overrides stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Font*

public override System.Drawing.Font Font { get; set; }
Value
Font

The Font to apply to the text displayed by the control. The default is the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultFont* property.

Remarks

This property is not relevant for this class.

ForeColor

Gets the foreground color of the track bar.

public override System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

Always stem.Drawing.SystemColors.WindowText*.

ImeMode

Gets or sets the Input Method Editor (IME) mode supported by this control.

public System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode ImeMode { get; set; }
Value
ImeMode

One of the ImeMode values.

LargeChange

Gets or sets a value to be added to or subtracted from the stem.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value* property when the scroll box is moved a large distance.

public int LargeChange { get; set; }
Value
Int32

A numeric value. The default is 5.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The assigned value is less than 0.

Remarks

When the user presses the PAGE UP or PAGE DOWN key or clicks the track bar on either side of the scroll box, the Value property changes according to the value set in the LargeChange property. You might consider setting the LargeChange value to a percentage of the Height (for a vertically oriented track bar) or Width (for a horizontally oriented track bar) value. This keeps the distance your track bar moves proportionate to its size.

Maximum

Gets or sets the upper limit of the range this TrackBar is working with.

public int Maximum { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The maximum value for the TrackBar. The default is 10.

Remarks

You can use the SetRange method to set both the Maximum and Minimum properties at the same time.

Minimum

Gets or sets the lower limit of the range this TrackBar is working with.

public int Minimum { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The minimum value for the TrackBar. The default is 0.

Remarks

You can use the SetRange method to set both the Maximum and Minimum properties at the same time.

Orientation

Gets or sets a value indicating the horizontal or vertical orientation of the track bar.

public System.Windows.Forms.Orientation Orientation { get; set; }
Value
Orientation

One of the Orientation values.

Exceptions
InvalidEnumArgumentException

The assigned value is not one of the Orientation values.

Remarks

When the Orientation property is set to System.Windows.Forms.Orientation, the scroll box moves from left to right as the Value increases. When the Orientation property is set to System.Windows.Forms.Orientation, the scroll box moves from bottom to top as the Value increases.

Padding

Gets or sets the space between the edges of a TrackBar control and its contents.

public System.Windows.Forms.Padding Padding { get; set; }
Value
Padding

A Padding object.

Remarks

The Padding property has no effect on the appearance of the TrackBar control; therefore, it is hidden in the designer and from IntelliSense.

RightToLeftLayout

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents of the TrackBar will be laid out from right to left.

public virtual bool RightToLeftLayout { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the contents of the TrackBar are laid out from right to left; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The RightToLeftLayout property is used with the RightToLeft property for international applications where the language is written from right to left, such as Hebrew or Arabic.

SmallChange

Gets or sets the value added to or subtracted from the stem.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value* property when the scroll box is moved a small distance.

public int SmallChange { get; set; }
Value
Int32

A numeric value. The default value is 1.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The assigned value is less than 0.

Remarks

When the user presses one of the arrow keys, the Value property changes according to the value set in the SmallChange property.

You might consider setting the value of SmallChange to a percentage of the value of the Height (for a vertically oriented track bar) or Width (for a horizontally oriented track bar) property. This sets the distance your track bar moves proportionate to its size.

Text

Gets or sets the text of the TrackBar.

public override string Text { get; set; }
Value
String

The text associated with this control.

Remarks

This property is not relevant for this class.

TickFrequency

Gets or sets a value that specifies the delta between ticks drawn on the control.

public int TickFrequency { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The numeric value representing the delta between ticks. The default is 1.

Remarks

For a TrackBar with a large range of values between the Minimum and the Maximum properties, it might be impractical to draw all the ticks for values on the control. For example, if you have a control with a range of 100, passing in a value of 5 here causes the control to draw 20 ticks. In this case, each tick represents five units in the range of values.

TickStyle

Gets or sets a value indicating how to display the tick marks on the track bar.

public System.Windows.Forms.TickStyle TickStyle { get; set; }
Value
TickStyle

One of the TickStyle values. The default is TickStyle.

Exceptions
InvalidEnumArgumentException

The assigned value is not a valid TickStyle.

Remarks

You can use the TickStyle property to modify the manner in which the tick marks are displayed on the track bar.

Value

Gets or sets a numeric value that represents the current position of the scroll box on the track bar.

public int Value { get; set; }
Value
Int32

A numeric value that is within the stem.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum* and stem.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum* range. The default value is 0.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The assigned value is less than the value of stem.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum*.

-or-

The assigned value is greater than the value of stem.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum*.

Remarks

The Value property contains the number that represents the current position of the scroll box on the track bar.

Methods

BeginInit()

Begins the initialization of a TrackBar that is used on a form or used by another component. The initialization occurs at run time.

public void BeginInit ();

Remarks

The Visual Studio design environment uses this method to start the initialization of a component that is used on a form or used by another component. The EndInit method ends the initialization. Using BeginInit and EndInit methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.

CreateHandle()

Overrides the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateHandle* method.

protected override void CreateHandle ();

EndInit()

Ends the initialization of a TrackBar that is used on a form or used by another component. The initialization occurs at run time.

public void EndInit ();

Remarks

The Visual Studio design environment uses this method to end the initialization of a component that is used on a form or used by another component. The BeginInit method starts the initialization. Using the BeginInit and EndInit methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.

IsInputKey(Keys)

Determines whether the specified key is a regular input key or a special key that requires preprocessing.

protected override bool IsInputKey (System.Windows.Forms.Keys keyData);
keyData
Keys

One of the Keys values.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified key is a regular input key; otherwise, false.

e

e

OnRightToLeftLayoutChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the RightToLeftLayoutChanged event.

protected virtual void OnRightToLeftLayoutChanged (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnRightToLeftLayoutChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnScroll(EventArgs)

Raises the Scroll event.

protected virtual void OnScroll (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

You can use the OnScroll event to update other controls as the position of the scroll box changes.

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnScroll method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnSystemColorsChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the SystemColorsChanged event.

protected override void OnSystemColorsChanged (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

The control will redraw when the system colors change.

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnSystemColorsChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnValueChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the ValueChanged event.

protected virtual void OnValueChanged (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

The EventArgs that contains the event data.

SetBoundsCore(Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,BoundsSpecified)

Performs the work of setting the specified bounds of this control.

protected override void SetBoundsCore (int x, int y, int width, int height, System.Windows.Forms.BoundsSpecified specified);
x
Int32

The new stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Left* property value of the control.

y
Int32

The new stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Top* property value of the control.

width
Int32

The new stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Width* property value of the control.

height
Int32

The new stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Height* property value of the control.

specified
BoundsSpecified

A bitwise combination of the BoundsSpecified values.

SetRange(Int32,Int32)

Sets the minimum and maximum values for a TrackBar.

public void SetRange (int minValue, int maxValue);
minValue
Int32

The lower limit of the range of the track bar.

maxValue
Int32

The upper limit of the range of the track bar.

Remarks

You can use this method to set the entire range for the TrackBar at the same time. To set the minimum or maximum values individually, use the Minimum and Maximum properties. If the minValue parameter is greater than the maxValue parameter, maxValue is set equal to minValue.

ToString()

Returns a string that represents the TrackBar control.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A string that represents the current TrackBar.

Remarks

The ToString method returns a string that includes the type and the values for the Minimum, Maximum, and Value properties.

WndProc(Message)

Overrides the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc* method.

protected override void WndProc (ref System.Windows.Forms.Message m);

Message

Example

Scroll

Occurs when either a mouse or keyboard action moves the scroll box.

public event EventHandler Scroll;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see Events.

TextChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Text* property changes.

public event EventHandler TextChanged;

ValueChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value* property of a track bar changes, either by movement of the scroll box or by manipulation in code.

public event EventHandler ValueChanged;

Remarks

You can use this event to update other controls when the value represented in the track bar changes.

For more information about handling events, see Events.
